University of California, Berkeley

Scientific Computing Excellence Since 1868

Welcome to the comprehensive documentation for the Berkeley SciComp Framework, a cutting-edge scientific computing platform developed at UC Berkeley.

Note

This framework represents the culmination of Berkeleyâ€™s commitment to excellence in computational physics, quantum mechanics, and scientific computing.

Quick StartÂ¶

Install the framework:

pip install berkeley-scicomp

Get started with a simple example:

from Quantum.core.quantum_states import BellStates
from visualization.berkeley_style import BerkeleyPlot

# Create a Bell state
bell = BellStates.phi_plus()

# Visualize with Berkeley styling
plotter = BerkeleyPlot()
plotter.plot_quantum_state(bell)

Key FeaturesÂ¶

ğŸ”¬ Quantum Physics

Complete quantum mechanics framework with Bell states, entanglement measures, and cavity QED simulations.

ğŸŒ¡ï¸ Thermal Transport

Advanced heat transfer simulations with finite element methods and multi-dimensional solvers.

ğŸŒŠ Signal Processing

Comprehensive FFT, spectral analysis, and time-frequency processing tools.

ğŸ¯ Optimization

Mathematical optimization suite including linear programming, genetic algorithms, and multi-objective optimization.

ğŸ§  Machine Learning

Physics-informed neural networks (PINNs), neural operators, and materials property prediction.

âš¡ GPU Acceleration

CUDA-accelerated computations with automatic CPU fallback.

ğŸ“Š Berkeley Integration

Official UC Berkeley branding, colors, and academic standards compliance.
